trans-unit.source: Query Timeout and Pagination
trans-unit.target: Query Timeout and Pagination

trans-unit.source: The Table service supports the following two types of query operations:
trans-unit.target: The Table service supports the following two types of query operations:

trans-unit.source: The <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Tables</link> operation returns the list of tables within the specified storage account.
trans-unit.target: The <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Tables</link> operation returns the list of tables within the specified storage account.

trans-unit.source: The list of tables may be filtered according to criteria specified on the request.
trans-unit.target: The list of tables may be filtered according to criteria specified on the request.

trans-unit.source: The <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link> operation returns a set of entities from the specified table.
trans-unit.target: The <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link> operation returns a set of entities from the specified table.

trans-unit.source: Query results may be filtered according to criteria specified on the request.
trans-unit.target: Query results may be filtered according to criteria specified on the request.

trans-unit.source: A query against the Table service may return a maximum of 1,000 items at one time and may execute for a maximum of five seconds.
trans-unit.target: A query against the Table service may return a maximum of 1,000 items at one time and may execute for a maximum of five seconds.

trans-unit.source: If the result set contains more than 1,000 items, if the query did not complete within five seconds, or if the query crosses the partition boundary, the response includes headers which provide the developer with continuation tokens to use in order to resume the query at the next item in the result set.
trans-unit.target: If the result set contains more than 1,000 items, if the query did not complete within five seconds, or if the query crosses the partition boundary, the response includes headers which provide the developer with continuation tokens to use in order to resume the query at the next item in the result set.

trans-unit.source: Continuation token headers may be returned for a <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Tables</link> operation or a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Entities</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: Continuation token headers may be returned for a <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Tables</link> operation or a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Entities</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: Note that the total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including the five seconds for query execution.
trans-unit.target: Note that the total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including the five seconds for query execution.

trans-unit.source: It is possible for a query to return no results but to still return a continuation header.
trans-unit.target: It is possible for a query to return no results but to still return a continuation header.

trans-unit.source: The continuation token headers are shown in the following table.
trans-unit.target: The continuation token headers are shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Continuation token header
trans-unit.target: Continuation token header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: This header is returned in the context of a <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Tables</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned in the context of a <link xlink:href="7010b048-a7cb-4c3a-b45e-99debe1c9f70" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Tables</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: If the list of tables returned is not complete, a hash of the name of the next table in the list is included in the continuation token header.
trans-unit.target: If the list of tables returned is not complete, a hash of the name of the next table in the list is included in the continuation token header.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned in the context of a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned in the context of a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: The header contains a hash of the next partition key to be returned in a subsequent query against the table.
trans-unit.target: The header contains a hash of the next partition key to be returned in a subsequent query against the table.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned in the context of a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned in the context of a <link xlink:href="8cfef6f9-eb7f-40f0-9016-dff44d36b6e1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Entities</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: The header contains a hash of the next row key to be returned in a subsequent query against the table.
trans-unit.target: The header contains a hash of the next row key to be returned in a subsequent query against the table.

trans-unit.source: Note that in some instances, <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey</parameterReference> may be <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Note that in some instances, <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey</parameterReference> may be <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: To retrieve the continuation tokens and execute a subsequent query to return the next page of results, first inspect the response headers for continuation tokens.
trans-unit.target: To retrieve the continuation tokens and execute a subsequent query to return the next page of results, first inspect the response headers for continuation tokens.

trans-unit.source: If there are no headers or the header values are <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword>, there are no additional entities to return.
trans-unit.target: If there are no headers or the header values are <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword>, there are no additional entities to return.

trans-unit.source: If you are handling continuation tokens manually using the Microsoft .NET Client Library, first cast the result of the query operation to a <externalLink><linkText>QueryOperationResponse</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=155325</linkUri></externalLink> object.
trans-unit.target: If you are handling continuation tokens manually using the Microsoft .NET Client Library, first cast the result of the query operation to a <externalLink><linkText>QueryOperationResponse</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=155325</linkUri></externalLink> object.

trans-unit.source: You can then access the continuation token headers in the <externalLink><linkText>Headers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=155326</linkUri></externalLink> property of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>QueryOperationResponse</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.
trans-unit.target: You can then access the continuation token headers in the <externalLink><linkText>Headers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=155326</linkUri></externalLink> property of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>QueryOperationResponse</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> object.

trans-unit.source: After you have retrieved the continuation tokens, use their values to construct a query to return the next page of results.
trans-unit.target: After you have retrieved the continuation tokens, use their values to construct a query to return the next page of results.

trans-unit.source: A query request URI may take these parameters, which correspond to the continuation token headers returned with the response:
trans-unit.target: A query request URI may take these parameters, which correspond to the continuation token headers returned with the response:

trans-unit.source: A client may set a timeout for a query operation by using the <externalLink><linkText>Timeout</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=155327</linkUri></externalLink> property of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DataServiceContext</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> class.
trans-unit.target: A client may set a timeout for a query operation by using the <externalLink><linkText>Timeout</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=155327</linkUri></externalLink> property of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>DataServiceContext</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> class.

trans-unit.source: The total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including five seconds for query execution.
trans-unit.target: The total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including five seconds for query execution.

trans-unit.source: If the operation is an insert or delete operation, the operation may have succeeded on the server despite an error being returned by the client.
trans-unit.target: If the operation is an insert or delete operation, the operation may have succeeded on the server despite an error being returned by the client.

trans-unit.source: This may happen when the client timeout is set to less than 30 seconds, which is the maximum timeout for an insert, update, or delete operation.
trans-unit.target: This may happen when the client timeout is set to less than 30 seconds, which is the maximum timeout for an insert, update, or delete operation.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response Headers and Subsequent Request
trans-unit.target: Sample Response Headers and Subsequent Request

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows a set of sample response headers from an entity query against a table named Customers that returns continuation headers.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows a set of sample response headers from an entity query against a table named Customers that returns continuation headers.

trans-unit.source: Both <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextPartitionKey</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey</parameterReference> are returned.
trans-unit.target: Both <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextPartitionKey</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey</parameterReference> are returned.

trans-unit.source: The request for the next page of data can be constructed like the following URI:
trans-unit.target: The request for the next page of data can be constructed like the following URI:
